content:
TITLE: Installing Ghostty on Arch Linux
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Ghostty from Arch Linux's extra repository using the pacman package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
pacman -S ghostty
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring App Notifications in Ghostty
DESCRIPTION: Configuration options for controlling in-app notifications in Ghostty. Supports enabling/disabling specific notification types like clipboard copy notifications. Uses a comma-separated list format with optional 'no-' prefix for disabling notifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
clipboard-copy
no-clipboard-copy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ghostty using AppImage on Linux
DESCRIPTION: Commands to make the Ghostty AppImage executable and run it. This provides a universal way to run Ghostty on various Linux distributions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
chmod +x Ghostty-x86_64.AppImage
./Ghostty-x86_64.AppImage
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Color Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Basic color configuration for terminal window including background, foreground, and selection colors. Colors can be specified in hex format or X11 color names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: config
CODE:
```
background = #RRGGBB
foreground = #RRGGBB
selection-foreground = #RRGGBB
selection-background = #RRGGBB
selection-invert-fg-bg = true|false
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Alpha Blending Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Configuration options for alpha blending in different color spaces. Affects text and image transparency rendering. Supports native, linear, and linear-corrected modes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: config
CODE:
```
alpha-blending = native|linear|linear-corrected
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Ghostty Configuration Syntax in INI
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic syntax for Ghostty configuration, including setting background and foreground colors, keybindings, and resetting values to defaults.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
# The syntax is "key = value". The whitespace around the
# equals doesn't matter.
background = 282c34
foreground = ffffff

# Comments start with a `#` and are only valid on their own line.
# Blank lines are ignored!

keybind = ctrl+z=close_surface
keybind = ctrl+d=new_split:right

# Empty values reset the configuration to the default value
font-family =
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Complete Custom Theme for Ghostty
DESCRIPTION: Example of a complete theme configuration file that defines all colors including palette entries, background, foreground, cursor colors, and selection colors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/features/theme.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
palette = 0=#51576d
palette = 1=#e78284
palette = 2=#a6d189
palette = 3=#e5c890
palette = 4=#8caaee
palette = 5=#f4b8e4
palette = 6=#81c8be
palette = 7=#a5adce
palette = 8=#626880
palette = 9=#e67172
palette = 10=#8ec772
palette = 11=#d9ba73
palette = 12=#7b9ef0
palette = 13=#f2a4db
palette = 14=#5abfb5
palette = 15=#b5bfe2
background = #303446
foreground = #c6d0f5
cursor-color = #f2d5cf
cursor-text = #c6d0f5
selection-background = #626880
selection-foreground = #c6d0f5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Shell Integration in Ghostty (INI)
DESCRIPTION: Examples of how to configure shell integration in Ghostty's configuration file. Shows how to force a specific shell integration or disable it entirely.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/features/shell-integration.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
shell-integration = fish
```

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
shell-integration = none
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Ghostty macOS App Bundle
DESCRIPTION: Commands to build the Ghostty macOS application bundle using Zig build and Xcode. This creates a ready-to-use .app file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
zig build -Doptimize=ReleaseFast
cd macos && xcodebuild
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Unicode Codepoint Keybinding for Non-US Layouts
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to bind a key using Unicode codepoints, which is useful for non-US keyboard layouts. This example binds the German 'รถ' key with Ctrl modifier.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/keybind/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
keybind = ctrl+รถ=action
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ghostty on Gentoo
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Ghostty from the official Gentoo repository using the emerge package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
emerge -av ghostty
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting a Built-in Theme in Ghostty Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Sets the terminal color scheme to the Catppuccin Frappe theme using the theme configuration option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/features/theme.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
theme = catppuccin-frappe
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cursor and Box Drawing Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Settings for cursor appearance and box drawing character rendering. Includes thickness and height adjustments for various cursor types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: config
CODE:
```
adjust-cursor-thickness = [value|percentage]
adjust-cursor-height = [value|percentage]
adjust-box-thickness = [value|percentage]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies on Debian and Ubuntu
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required dependencies for building Ghostty on Debian-based distributions including Ubuntu using apt.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
sudo apt install libgtk-4-dev libadwaita-1-dev git blueprint-compiler gettext
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Performable Keybindings in Ghostty
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set up a performable keybinding that only consumes the input if the action can be performed. This example shows a Ctrl+C binding that will only copy to clipboard if text is selected, otherwise passing the input to the terminal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/release-notes/1-1-0.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: toml
CODE:
```
keybind = performable:ctrl+c=copy_to_clipboard
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking and Setting Xcode Developer Path
DESCRIPTION: Commands to check and set the active Xcode developer directory path on macOS, which is required for building the Ghostty app bundle.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
xcode-select --print-path
/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools        # <-- BAD

sudo xcode-select --switch /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer
xcode-select --print-path
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer # <-- GOOD
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration File Loading Example
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the order of configuration file loading in Ghostty, showing how nested config files are processed after their parent configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: conf
CODE:
```
config-file = "foo"
a = 1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: macOS Titlebar Style Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Configuration values for the macOS titlebar style. Supports 'native', 'transparent', 'tabs', and 'hidden' options, each with different visual and functional characteristics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
native
transparent
tabs
hidden
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Keybinding Syntax in Ghostty
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the fundamental syntax for creating a keybinding in Ghostty, showing how to associate a trigger with an action.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/keybind/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
keybind = trigger=action
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copying Terminfo Entry to Remote Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to export the local Ghostty terminfo entry and import it on a remote server. Uses infocmp to export and tic to import the terminfo definition.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/help/terminfo.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
infocmp -x | ssh YOUR-SERVER -- tic -x -
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring GTK Single Instance Mode in Ghostty
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to force GTK single instance mode on in Ghostty's configuration file. Setting this option to true ensures that each new Ghostty process creates a new window in an existing instance if one is running.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/help/gtk-single-instance.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
gtk-single-instance = true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies on Alpine Linux
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required dependencies for building Ghostty on Alpine Linux using the apk package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
doas apk add gtk4.0-dev libadwaita-dev pkgconf ncurses blueprint-compiler gettext
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Ghostty Auto-Update Channel to Prerelease
DESCRIPTION: Configuration snippet to switch Ghostty from stable to prerelease channel by modifying the auto-update-channel setting. Requires restarting Ghostty for the change to take effect.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/pre.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
auto-update-channel = tip
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Splitting Ghostty Configuration into Multiple Files
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to split Ghostty configuration across multiple files using the config-file key, including relative paths, absolute paths, and optional files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
config-file = some/relative/sub/config
config-file = ?optional/config
config-file = /absolute/path/config
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ghostty-git from AUR on Arch Linux
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the development version of Ghostty from the Arch User Repository (AUR) using the yay helper. This installs the latest version from the main branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
# Install Ghostty git
yay -S ghostty-git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Table for Common Issues and Solutions
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table listing common Ghostty issues and links to their solutions, including terminfo errors, window manager conflicts, performance issues, and shell configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/help/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Issue | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| Error "missing or unsuitable terminal" when running commands or using SSH. | [Terminfo](/docs/help/terminfo) |
| macOS window managers such as Yabai or Aerospace act strange | [macOS Tiling Window Managers](/docs/help/macos-tiling-wms) |
| Ghostty has slow startup or high memory usage on Linux. | [GTK Single Instance](/docs/help/gtk-single-instance) |
| macOS defaults to login shells | [macOS Login Shells](/docs/help/macos-login-shells)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies on Gentoo
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required dependencies for building Ghostty on Gentoo using emerge.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
emerge -av libadwaita gtk blueprint-compiler gettext
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies on openSUSE Tumbleweed
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required dependencies for building Ghostty on openSUSE Tumbleweed using zypper.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
sudo zypper install gtk4-devel libadwaita-devel pkgconf ncurses-devel zig blueprint-compiler gettext
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Ghostty in NixOS
DESCRIPTION: NixOS configuration snippet to add Ghostty to system packages using the nixpkgs unstable channel.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: nix
CODE:
```
environment.systemPackages = [
  pkgs.ghostty
];
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Window Decoration Configuration Example
DESCRIPTION: Example showing that if server-side decoration is set but not supported by the environment, client-side decorations will be used instead.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
If `server` is set but the environment doesn't support server-side\ndecorations, client-side decorations will be used instead.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ghostty via Homebrew on macOS
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Ghostty using Homebrew package manager on macOS. This installs the Ghostty cask which is maintained by the Ghostty community.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
brew install --cask ghostty
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Out a Specific Release Tag
DESCRIPTION: Command to check out a specific release tag when building Ghostty. This ensures you're building a stable release rather than the development version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git checkout <tag>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ghostty on openSUSE
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Ghostty from the official openSUSE Tumbleweed repository using the zypper package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
zypper install ghostty
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Ghostty with Zig
DESCRIPTION: Command to build Ghostty using Zig with release optimizations. This creates a binary optimized for performance rather than debugging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
zig build -Doptimize=ReleaseFast
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fish Shell Sudo Integration Fix
DESCRIPTION: Fixes for sudo integration in the Fish shell environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/release-notes/1-1-0.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: fish
CODE:
```
# No explicit code provided in the changelog
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ghostty to User Home Directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to build and install Ghostty to the user's home directory, making it available only to the current user. This ensures proper setup of desktop integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
zig build -p $HOME/.local -Doptimize=ReleaseFast
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: SSH Config for Terminfo Fallback
DESCRIPTION: SSH configuration to set a fallback TERM value when connecting to remote servers that don't have Ghostty's terminfo entry. Requires OpenSSH 8.7 or newer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/help/terminfo.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: ssh-config
CODE:
```
# .ssh/config
Host example.com
  SetEnv TERM=xterm-256color
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Custom GLSL Shader Integration in Ghostty
DESCRIPTION: Custom shader implementation following the Shadertoy API format. Requires OpenGL 4.2 on Linux and provides access to terminal screen texture through iChannel0 uniform. The shader must implement a mainImage function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: glsl
CODE:
```
void mainImage( /* shader entry point - follows Shadertoy API format */
    // Available uniforms match Shadertoy
    // iChannel0 contains the rendered terminal screen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Ghostty Package with Nix
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the Ghostty package using Nix. This provides higher reproducibility guarantees than building directly with Zig.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
nix build .#ghostty
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Control Sequence Table in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown table documenting various VT control sequences, escape sequences, and CSI (Control Sequence Introducer) commands supported by Ghostty terminal emulator. Each entry includes the sequence name, syntax pattern, and brief description.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Name | Syntax | Description |
|------|------|-------------|
| [BEL](/docs/vt/control/bel) | `0x07`  | Alert the user (beep) |
| [BS](/docs/vt/control/bs) | `0x08`  | Move cursor backward one position |
| [TAB](/docs/vt/control/tab) | `0x09`  | Move cursor right to the next tab stop |
| [LF](/docs/vt/control/lf) | `0x0A`  | Move cursor down one line, scrolling if necessary |
| [CR](/docs/vt/control/cr) | `0x0D`  | Move cursor to the left margin |
| [DECSC](/docs/vt/esc/decsc) | `ESC 7` | Save cursor |
| [DECRC](/docs/vt/esc/decrc) | `ESC 8` | Restore cursor |
| [IND](/docs/vt/esc/ind) | `ESC D` | Move cursor down, scrolling if necessary |
| [RI](/docs/vt/esc/ri) | `ESC M` | Move cursor up, scrolling if necessary |
| [RIS](/docs/vt/esc/ris) | `ESC c` | Full reset |
| [DECSCUSR](/docs/vt/esc/decscusr) | `ESC Pn " " q` | Set cursor style |
| [DECKPAM](/docs/vt/esc/deckpam) | `ESC =` | Set numeric keypad to application mode |
| [DECKPNM](/docs/vt/esc/deckpnm) | `ESC >` | Set numeric keypad to numeric mode |
| [DECALN](/docs/vt/esc/decaln) | `ESC # 8` | Screen alignment test |
| [CUU](/docs/vt/csi/cuu) | `CSI Pn A` | Move cursor up |
| [CUD](/docs/vt/csi/cud) | `CSI Pn B` | Move cursor down |
| [CUF](/docs/vt/csi/cuf) | `CSI Pn C` | Move cursor right |
| [CUB](/docs/vt/csi/cub) | `CSI Pn D` | Move cursor left |
| [CNL](/docs/vt/csi/cnl) | `CSI Pn E` | Move cursor down `n` lines and to the leftmost column |
| [CPL](/docs/vt/csi/cpl) | `CSI Pn F` | Move cursor up `n` lines and to the leftmost column |
| [CUP](/docs/vt/csi/cup) | `CSI Py ; Px H` | Move cursor to the specified row and column |
| [CHT](/docs/vt/csi/cht) | `CSI Pn I` | Move cursor right `n` tabs |
| [ED](/docs/vt/csi/ed) | `CSI Pn J` | Erase display |
| [EL](/docs/vt/csi/el) | `CSI Pn K` | Erase line |
| [DL](/docs/vt/csi/dl) | `CSI Pn M` | Delete `n` lines at the cursor |
| [IL](/docs/vt/csi/il) | `CSI Pn L` | Insert `n` lines at the cursor |
| [DCH](/docs/vt/csi/dch) | `CSI Pn P` | Delete `n` characters at the cursor |
| [SU](/docs/vt/csi/su) | `CSI Pn S` | Scroll up `n` lines |
| [SD](/docs/vt/csi/sd) | `CSI Pn T` | Scroll down `n` lines |
| [ECH](/docs/vt/csi/ech) | `CSI Pn X` | Erase `n` characters at the cursor |
| [CBT](/docs/vt/csi/cbt) | `CSI Pn Z` | Move cursor left `n` tabs |
| [HPR](/docs/vt/csi/hpr) | `CSI Pn a` | Move cursor to a column relative to the cursor |
| [REP](/docs/vt/csi/rep) | `CSI Pn b` | Repeat the preceding character `n` times |
| [VPA](/docs/vt/csi/vpa) | `CSI Py d` | Move cursor to the specified row |
| [VPR](/docs/vt/csi/vpr) | `CSI Pn e` | Move cursor down `n` rows relative to the cursor |
| [TBC](/docs/vt/csi/tbc) | `CSI Pn g` | Clear one or all tab stops |
| [DSR](/docs/vt/csi/dsr) | `CSI Pn n` | Device status report |
| [DECSTBM](/docs/vt/csi/decstbm) | `CSI Pt ; Pb r` | Set top and bottom margins |
| [DECSLRM](/docs/vt/csi/decslrm) | `CSI Pl ; Pr s` | Set left and right margins |
| [ICH](/docs/vt/csi/ich) | `CSI Pn @` | Insert `n` characters at the cursor |
| [HPA](/docs/vt/csi/hpa) | `CSI Px ` | Move cursor to the specified column |
| [XTSHIFTESCAPE](/docs/vt/csi/xtshiftescape) | `CSI > Pn s` | Configure `shift` modifier behavior with mouse reports |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Bash Path Abbreviation Update
DESCRIPTION: Changes bash path display from using $PWD to \w for abbreviated titles.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/release-notes/1-1-0.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
\w
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ghostty Prerelease via Homebrew
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the prerelease version of Ghostty using Homebrew on macOS. This uses the community-maintained @tip version rather than the official auto-update-channel method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/pre.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
brew install --cask ghostty@tip
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Aerospace to Handle Ghostty Windows
DESCRIPTION: This configuration for Aerospace window manager detects Ghostty windows and forces them into tiling layout to mitigate the issue of tabs appearing as separate windows. An alternative is to use floating layout and manually unfloat the window after startup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/help/macos-tiling-wms.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: toml
CODE:
```
[[on-window-detected]]
if.app-id="com.mitchellh.ghostty"
run= [
  "layout tiling",
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Theme Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Theme configuration supporting built-in themes, custom themes, and light/dark mode switching. Themes can be specified as absolute paths or named themes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: config
CODE:
```
theme = theme-name|/path/to/theme|light:theme-name,dark:theme-name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Validating ICH: Outside Left/Right Scroll Region (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates ICH behavior when inserting characters outside a defined left/right scroll region.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/csi/ich.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left
printf "\033[0J" # clear screen
printf "\033[?69h" # enable left/right margins
printf "\033[3;5s" # scroll region left/right
printf "\033[3G"
printf "ABC"
printf "\033[1G"
printf "\033[2@"
printf "X"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning the Ghostty Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Ghostty repository from GitHub and navigate to the project directory. This is the first step in building Ghostty from source.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/ghostty-org/ghostty
cd ghostty
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies on Arch Linux
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required dependencies for building Ghostty on Arch Linux using the pacman package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/build.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
sudo pacman -S gtk4 libadwaita blueprint-compiler gettext
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration Example - Color Value Format
DESCRIPTION: Shows the new support for shorthand hex color values in configuration
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/release-notes/1-0-1.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
#ABC
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: File Permission Mode Update

TITLE: DCS Sequence Syntax Format
DESCRIPTION: Defines the formal syntax for Device Control Sequence (DCS) sequences. DCS sequences combine features of CSI and OSC sequences, supporting both integer parameters and string values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/concepts/sequences.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
dsc_sequence = "0x1B" "P" params intermediates final data ST
params = param | param ";" params
param = [0-9]
intermediates = [0x20-0x2F]*
final = [0x40-0x7E]
data = [0x20-0xFF]
ST = "0x1B" "0x5C"
```

```

TITLE: Using Ghostty with Nix Flake
DESCRIPTION: Example Nix flake configuration to add Ghostty to a NixOS system. This approach allows tracking specific commits of Ghostty using the official Ghostty flake.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: nix
CODE:
```
{
  inputs = {
    nixpkgs.url = "github:NixOS/nixpkgs/nixos-unstable";

    ghostty = {
      url = "github:ghostty-org/ghostty";
    };
  };

  outputs = {
    nixpkgs,
    ghostty,
    ...
  }: {
    nixosConfigurations.mysystem = nixpkgs.lib.nixosSystem {
      modules = [
        ({ pkgs, ... }: {
          environment.systemPackages = [
            ghostty.packages.${pkgs.stdenv.hostPlatform.system}.default
          ];
        })
      ];
    };
  };
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Yabai to Handle Ghostty Windows
DESCRIPTION: This Yabai configuration adds signal handlers for Ghostty window creation and destruction events, ensuring the space layout is reset to binary space partitioning (bsp) mode when Ghostty windows are created or destroyed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/help/macos-tiling-wms.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yabai -m signal --add app='^Ghostty$' event=window_created action='yabai -m space --layout bsp'
yabai -m signal --add app='^Ghostty$' event=window_destroyed action='yabai -m space --layout bsp'
```

```

TITLE: Validating Cursor Position with Save Cursor (DECSC) in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how the Save Cursor (DECSC) sequence preserves cursor position. It places a cursor at position 1,5, prints 'A', saves the cursor position, moves to the top-left corner, prints 'B', restores the cursor, and finally prints 'X'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/esc/decsc.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left
printf "\033[0J" # clear screen
printf "\033[1;5H"
printf "A"
printf "\0337" # Save Cursor
printf "\033[1;1H"
printf "B"
printf "\0338" # Restore Cursor
printf "X"
```

printf "\033[5n"
```

TITLE: CSI Sequence Syntax Format
DESCRIPTION: Defines the formal syntax for Control Sequence Introducer (CSI) sequences. CSI sequences begin with ESC [ and are used to encode integer parameters with specific separators and terminators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/concepts/sequences.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
csi_sequence = "0x1B" "[" params intermediates final
params = param | param sep params
param = [0-9]
sep = ";" | ":"
intermediates = [0x20-0x2F]*
final = [0x40-0x7E]
```

TITLE: Performable Keybinds Menu Shortcut Behavior
DESCRIPTION: Explains how performable keybinds interact with application menu shortcuts, noting that they won't appear as menu shortcut labels but will still function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/config/reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Performable keybinds will not appear as menu shortcuts in the\napplication menu. This is because the menu shortcuts force the\naction to be performed regardless of the state of the terminal.\nPerformable keybinds will still work, they just won't appear as\na shortcut label in the menu.
```

TITLE: CUP with Origin Mode and Left/Right Margins
DESCRIPTION: Shows how cursor positioning works when both origin mode and left/right margins are enabled, constraining the cursor within the defined region.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/csi/cup.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

printf "\033[0J" # clear screen
printf "\033[?69h" # enable left/right margins
printf "\033[3;5s" # scroll region left/right
printf "\033[2;3r" # scroll region top/bottom
printf "\033[?6h" # origin mode
printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left
printf "X"
```

printf "\033[0J" # clear screen

printf "\033[2;5r" # scroll region top/bottom
printf "\033[4S"
```

printf "A"
printf "\033D" # index
printf "X"

TITLE: Validating SGR Attribute Preservation with Save Cursor (DECSC) in Bash

SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/esc/decsc.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

printf "\033[1;4;33;44m"
printf "A"
printf "\0337" # Save Cursor
printf "\033[0m"
printf "B"
printf "\0338" # Restore Cursor
printf "X"
```

TITLE: Adding Ghostty COPR Repository on Fedora Silverblue
DESCRIPTION: Commands to add the Ghostty COPR repository to Fedora Silverblue or other Atomic Desktops. This creates the repository configuration file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/install/binary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
echo -e "
[copr:copr.fedorainfracloud.org:pgdev:ghostty]
name=Copr repo for Ghostty owned by pgdev
baseurl=https://download.copr.fedorainfracloud.org/results/pgdev/ghostty/fedora-$releasever-$basearch/
type=rpm-md
skip_if_unavailable=True
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://download.copr.fedorainfracloud.org/results/pgdev/ghostty/pubkey.gpg
repo_gpgcheck=0
enabled=1
enabled_metadata=1" | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/_copr:copr.fedorainfracloud.org:pgdev:ghostty.repo > /dev/null
```

TITLE: Testing RI Outside of Top/Bottom Scroll Region
DESCRIPTION: This test shows how Reverse Index behaves when the cursor is outside a defined top/bottom scroll region. It positions the cursor outside the defined region before performing the reverse index.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/esc/ri.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash

```
printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left

printf "\033M" # reverse index

TITLE: Testing CR with Left Margin and Origin Mode
DESCRIPTION: This script demonstrates CR behavior with both origin mode and left/right margins enabled, showing how CR positions the cursor at the left margin regardless of the cursor's starting position when origin mode is active.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/control/cr.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left
printf "\033[0J" # clear screen
printf "\033[?6h" # enable origin mode
printf "\033[?69h" # enable left/right margin mode
printf "\033[2;5s" # set left/right margin

printf "A"
printf "\033[1G"
printf "\r"
printf "X"

TITLE: SOS and PM Sequence Syntax Format
DESCRIPTION: Defines the formal syntax for Start Of String (SOS) and Privacy Message (PM) sequences. These sequences are entirely ignored by the Ghostty terminal emulator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/concepts/sequences.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
sos_sequence = "0x1B" "X" data ST
pm_sequence = "0x1B" "^" data ST
data = [0x20-0xFF]
ST = "0x1B" "0x5C"
```

printf "GHI789\n"

printf "\033[2;2H"
printf "\033[L"
```

TITLE: Validating Pending Wrap State with Save Cursor (DECSC) in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how Save Cursor (DECSC) preserves the pending wrap state. It positions the cursor at the last column, prints 'A', saves cursor state, moves to top-left, prints 'B', restores the cursor, and prints 'X' which wraps to the next line.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/esc/decsc.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cols=$(tput cols)
printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left
printf "\033[0J" # clear screen
printf "\033[${cols}G"
printf "A"
printf "\0337" # Save Cursor
printf "\033[1;1H"
printf "B"
printf "\0338" # Restore Cursor
printf "X"
```

TITLE: Testing RI with No Scroll Region Not at Top of Screen
DESCRIPTION: This test shows how Reverse Index behaves when the cursor is not at the top of the screen. It positions the cursor at the second line before performing the reverse index operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/esc/ri.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left
printf "\033[0J" # clear screen

printf "\033[2;1H"
printf "\033M" # reverse index
printf "X"
```

TITLE: Validating CUF with Left/Right Margins (Right of Margin) in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Tests cursor forward behavior when starting right of the right margin. The script enables left/right margins, sets a scroll region, positions the cursor to the right of the margin, attempts to move far right, and prints 'X'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ghostty-org/website/blob/main/docs/vt/csi/cuf.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left
printf "\033[0J" # clear screen
printf "\033[?69h" # enable left/right margins
printf "\033[3;5s" # scroll region left/right
printf "\033[6G" # move to right of margin
printf "\033[500C" # forward larger than screen width
printf "X"
```

TITLE: Scroll Up with Top/Bottom Scroll Region in Bash

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
printf "\033[1;1H" # move to top-left
printf "\033[0J" # clear screen
printf "ABC\n"
printf "DEF\n"
printf "GHI\n"
printf "\033[2;3r" # scroll region top/bottom
printf "\033[1;1H"
printf "\033[S"
```
